## Description

The first step when creating a website is to set up your development environment that would enable you to work.

## Acceptance criteria

Check the items in the list below, as you are doing them:

- [ ] Setup [VSCode](https://code.visualstudio.com/)
- [ ] Install recommended extensions: [Prettier](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=esbenp.prettier-vscode), [Live Server](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ritwickdey.LiveServer), [Code Spell Checker](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=streetsidesoftware.code-spell-checker)
- [ ] Create a folder where you will work on this assignment 
- [ ] Open VSCode in that folder (File -> Open Folder)
- [ ] Create a basic HTML page, called `index.html`. Use [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Introduction_to_HTML/Getting_started) as reference.
- [ ] Use [Live Server](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ritwickdey.LiveServer) to view live changes in the HTML page in your web browser.
title: Setup development environment

## Description

Any website needs to have a topic, and planning for the pages that are going to be included in it.

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Decide on a topic for your website
- [ ] Plan the pages that are to be included. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Getting_started_with_the_web/What_will_your_website_look_like). Gather resources and assets.
- [ ] Create the pages as empty `html` files.
title: Plan website structure

body:
## Description

Create the initial landing page for your website, `index.html`. This will have navigation to the other pages, some general information about your topic and a table.

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] The html document should follow a semantic structure. See [web.dev](https://web.dev/learn/html/semantic-html/).
- [ ] A navigation list (`<nav>`) shows links to all the pages to be included in the website
- [ ] The page starts with a level 1 header "Overview"
- [ ] A paragraph contains a general description of your topic
- [ ] A second level 2 header exists
- [ ] A table (`<table>`) exists to show a some general information. 
- [ ] The table should have at a minimum four columns and four rows.
- [ ] Some cells/rows need to be merged (use `colspan/rowspan`).
- [ ] The browsers tab displays the name of the topic you chose.
title: Create the general overview page

body:
## Description

The topic of your interest must have some history. Include it here.

This page will have some paragraphs, some nested lists and and images inserted throughout. 

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Navigation allows the user to navigate between all pages.
- [ ] A structure with at least two levels of header nesting should exist
- [ ] All years are shown using using the [`<strong>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/strong) importance element.
- [ ] All names are shown as emphasized, using [`<em>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/em). 
- [ ] Ordered or unordered lists should be used, with at least one level of nesting.
- [ ] The browsers tab follows the format `History - Topic Name`.
title: Create history page

body:
## Description

For example, if the topic you chose is a sport, list out its rules. If it's a hobby, list out its general guidelines.

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Navigation allows the user to navigate between all pages.
- [ ] A structure with at least two levels of header nesting should exist
- [ ] Use the [`<details>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/details) element to show some additional information
- [ ] Embed a video. It can either be a local video file, or a video from a video hosting website.
- [ ] The browsers tab follows the format `Rules - Topic Name`.
title: Create a page about how the topic works

body:
## Description

There are some notable people through the history that left their mark on your topic

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] Navigation allows the user to navigate between all pages.
- [ ] Create a table that lists notable people. At least 5 rows should be added.
- [ ] The following columns should exist: _Name_, _Photo_, _Age_, _Details_.
- [ ] The _Name_ column should contain a link to an external page with more information.
- [ ] The _Photo_ column should contain an embedded image. All images should be the same height.
- [ ] The _Details_ column should contain paragraphs, lists, or even nested tables
- [ ] The browsers tab follows the format `Notable People - Topic Name`.
title: Create a page for notable people
